par.text: Selenium is found in nature only in minute amounts. Its compounds occur mostly as impurities in ores of other elements, chiefly sulphide minerals. Selenium ores are very rare. The mineral eucairite CuAgSe is the only mineral which is fairly rich in selenium. Selenium makes up
% of the Earth's crust by weight, and ranks 67th for abundance among the elements found in the Earth's crust.
